title: Judge may decide fate of Biden’s migrant asylum rules within a week
description: A federal judge grilled Biden officials about asylum restrictions on the border and said he would decide within a week whether the rules are against the law.

title: Auckland shooting leaves 2 dead, 6 hurt hours before women’s World Cup opens
description: New Zealand's prime minister said there was no ongoing risk after the rare shooting, which happened about 12 hours before the first FIFA World Cup game.

title: He and his dog spent 3 months at sea. They’re finally on dry land.
description: Adrift in the blue vastness of the Pacific Ocean with only a dog named Bella for company, Timothy Shaddock didn’t think he was going to survive.

title: Prigozhin says Wagner mercenary group for now will not fight in Ukraine
description: Prigozhin vowed to continue operating in Africa and turn the military of Belarus, his new host country, into “the second army in the world.”

title: Marga Minco, Holocaust writer of understated power, dies at 103
description: Her best-selling novel “Bitter Herbs,” based on her wartime experience in the Netherlands, made her one of her country's most distinguished women of letters.

title: Russia pummels Odessa with air strikes
description: Russia hammered the port city of Odessa in southern Ukraine for a second day after a Ukrainian attack on the Crimean Bridge and a decision by Moscow to resume a blockade of grain shipments.

title: Putin, facing war crimes arrest, will skip BRICS summit in South Africa
description: Putin's decision not to attend a summit of the BRICS group of nations ends a diplomatic quandary over whether the Russian leader would be arrested on an International Criminal Court warrant.

title: In photos: The scene in Nairobi as Kenyans protest tax hikes and rising prices
description: Kenyans braced for more violence on Wednesday after a three-day protest began over tax hikes and rising prices. Police shut off roads leading to the presidency, businesses closed in the capital’s center, and commuter trains were suspended.

title: What we know about U.S. soldier Travis King, detained in North Korea
description: U.S. soldier Travis T. King is believed to be in North Korean custody after running across the border during a tour of the Joint Security Area.

title: As the world sizzles, China says it will deal with climate its own way
description: John Kerry is finishing a trip to Beijing, and the need for China and the United States to take concerted action on climate change has never been more evident.

title: Kenyans protest tax hikes as police respond with tear gas
description: Many say the government of William Ruto should crack down on corruption in Kenya before reaching into the pockets of citizens hit hard by rising food prices.

title: What happened to Americans held previously in North Korea?
description: Private Travis T. King is the first American to be in North Korean custody in five years. Before that, student Otto Warmbier, evangelists and journalists were held.

title: Palestinians report surge in Israeli assaults on West Bank medics
description: The Red Crescent said Israeli soldiers have physically assaulted medics, targeted their ambulances and blocked crews from accessing the injured.

title: Move over Megan Rapinoe: Meet Tazuni, the blue-haired World Cup penguin
description: The mascot for the soccer tournament, starting in Australia and New Zealand on Thursday, takes its name from the Tasman Sea and the tournament theme: "unity."

title: Ukraine live briefing: Assault on Odessa continues; U.N. explores grain export ideas
description: Residents in Odessa were told to shelter after cruise missiles were launched, as Russia continued to retaliate against the Crimean Bridge attack.

title: It’s the Republicans, not the Democrats, who are radical on Israel
description: The GOP has tied itself to Israel's far-right settler movement and is moving beyond the two-state solution, once an article of faith for both U.S. parties.

title: In Central Asia, a hidden pipeline supplies Russia with high-tech weapons
description: In Central Asia, a hidden pipeline of illicit trade supplies Russia with high-tech weapons, including Chinese drones and German electronics.

title: Henry Kissinger makes surprise visit to China, meets defense minister
description: The 100-year-old's visit to Beijing coincides with climate envoy John F. Kerry's arrival in the Chinese capital — and Kissinger had a much warmer welcome.
